a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif;font-weight:500

text.tspan: Shown is the "trade openness index". This index is defined as the sum of world exports and imports, divided by world
GDP. Each series corresponds to a different source.
Data source: Feenstra et al. (2015), Penn World Table (2021), Estevadeordal, Frantz, and Taylor (2003), Klasing and Milionis (2014)
